text: Elihu Asserts God’s Justice
Thus\f + \fr 34:1 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* Elihu ⸤spoke up⸥\f + \fr 34:1 \ft Literally “answered”; see NET \f* and said,
“Hear my words, you wise men,
and listen to me, you who know,
for \add the\add* ear tests words,
and \add the\add* palate tastes ⸤food⸥.\f + \fr 34:3 \ft Literally “to eat” \f*
Let us choose justice for ourselves;
let us determine among ourselves what \add is\add* good—
for Job has said, ‘I am righteous,
but God has taken away my justice.
Should I lie concerning my justice?
\add Though I am\add* without transgression, my wound caused by an arrow is incurable.’
What man \add is\add* like Job,
who drinks scorn like water?
And he goes on the road in company with instigators of mischief,
and walks with men of wickedness.
Indeed, he says, ‘A man does not profit
when he takes delight in God.’
“Therefore, listen to me, ⸤people who have sense⸥:\f + \fr 34:10 \ft Literally “men of heart” \f*
far be it from God ⸤that he should commit wickedness⸥\f + \fr 34:10 \ft Literally “from wickedness” \f*
and that Shaddai ⸤should do wrong⸥.\f + \fr 34:10 \ft Literally “from wrong” \f*
Indeed, he will repay \add according to\add* a human being’s deeds,
and according to a man’s way he will let \add it\add* happen \add to\add* him.
What’s more, God truly does not act wickedly,
and Shaddai does not pervert justice.
Who gave him charge \add over the\add* earth?
Or\f + \fr 34:13 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* who laid on \add him\add* \add the\add* whole world?
If he should set his heart to it,
and he should gather his spirit and his breath to himself,
all flesh would perish together,
and humankind would return to dust.
“But\f + \fr 34:16 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* if \add you have\add* understanding, hear this;
listen to ⸤what I say⸥.\f + \fr 34:16 \ft Literally “the voice/sound of my words” \f*
Shall \add he who\add* hates justice really govern?
Or will you\f + \fr 34:17 \ft Singular \f* declare \add the\add* Righteous One, the Mighty, guilty?—
the one who says to a king,
‘You worthless man,’ to noblemen, ‘You wicked man,’
who ⸤shows no partiality to officials⸥\f + \fr 34:19 \ft Literally “he does not lift the face of officials” \f*

and \add who\add* ⸤does not take note of the noble more than of the insignificant⸥,\f + \fr 34:19 \ft Literally “he does not regard \fq the \ft eminent to the face of \fq the \ft poor/insignificant” \f*
for all of them \add are\add* the work of his hands?
\add In\add* a moment they die,
and \add in\add* the middle of \add the\add* night \add the\add* people are shaken, and they pass away,
and they take away \add the\add* mighty ⸤effortlessly⸥.\f + \fr 34:20 \ft Literally “not by a hand” \f*
“Indeed, his eyes \add are\add* upon \add the\add* ways of man,
and he sees all his steps.
There is no darkness, and there is no deep shadow
where instigators of mischief might hide themselves.
Indeed, he has not yet appointed \add a time\add* for man
to go to God in the judgment.
He shatters the mighty without investigation,
and he sets others in their place.
Therefore he knows their works,
and he overturns \add them\add* \add in the\add* night
⸤so that⸥\f + \fr 34:25 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* they are crushed.
He strikes them ⸤where the wicked stood⸥,\f + \fr 34:26 \ft Literally “among \fq the \ft wicked” \f*
⸤where there are onlookers⸥,\f + \fr 34:26 \ft Literally “in \fq the \ft place of seers” \f*
because they have turned aside from him
and have not understood any of his ways,
so that \add they\add* cause \add the\add* cry of distress from \add the\add* helpless to come to him,
and he hears \add the\add* cry of distress from \add the\add* needy,
but he remains quiet, and who can condemn?
And he hides \add his\add* face, and who can behold him?
Yet\f + \fr 34:29 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* \add he is\add* over a nation and over a person alike,
so that godless human beings should not reign,
nor those who ensnare \add the\add* people.
“Indeed, does anyone say to God, ‘I have endured \add chastisement\add*;
I will not act corruptly \add again\add*;
teach me yourself ⸤what I cannot see⸥;\f + \fr 34:32 \ft Literally “apart from \fq what \ft I can see” \f*
if I have done wrong, I will not repeat \add it\add*’?
⸤According to your judgment⸥,\f + \fr 34:33 \ft Literally “from with you” \f* must he repay \add it\add* because you rejected \add this\add*?
Indeed, you must choose, and not I, so\f + \fr 34:33 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* declare what you know.
⸤Those who have sense⸥\f + \fr 34:34 \ft Literally “Men of heart” \f* say to me,
and \add the\add* wise man hearing me \add says\add*:
‘Job speaks without knowledge,
and his words \add are\add* without insight.
Would that Job were tested up to \add the\add* end
because \add his\add* answers \add are\add* like \add those from\add* men of mischief,
for he adds transgression to his sin;
he claps hands among us,
and he multiplies his words against God.’ ”
